content: Without regard to the merits or demerits of this connecting road ... I would note a couple of things. - Microsoft is paying for nearly 50% of the bridge and traffic using the bridge will be about 42% Microsoft employees - None of these so-called infrastructure projects were in the stimulus bill so "reading the bill" wouldn't have made any difference in their selection - Under the stimulus bill, money gets allocated to states for "infrastructure". The states choose the projects to fund using those dollars within certain stimulus bill imposed constraints, among which is TIME to get the project up and running. What is happening is that states, in order to secure their share of the stimulus money, are throwing every project they can scrape up and get going QUICKLY into the pot. One state, for example, is fencing a bridge that had a grand total of TWO suicides off it in 2008. They had already opted not to fund the fencing themselves ... but reversed course like drunken sailors when the stimulus dollars came along. This is not what I had in mind when POTUS 44 spoke of upgrading our infrastructure for the rest of the century.
